data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, the first thing you can move towards is the far left. If you always face forward, you can move towards the far right. If you always face to the right, you can move towards the far left. If you always face to the left, you can move towards the far right. If you always face to the left, you can move towards the far right. If you always face to the left, you can move towards the far right. The starting point must always be forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, the starting point is always facing forward. The first set of instructions goes against this. For instance, if you always face forward and take 10 steps right, then 4 of these directions go against your directions: Taking 7 steps backward means you still face forward. They also go against your order of steps: 3 steps left = 4 steps right. Again, they go against your order of steps: 3 steps backward means they still face their orders. Therefore, they are in order of the amount of steps taken: 3 steps backward takes you back to the starting point (4 steps backward, 8 steps backward, 3 steps backward and 1 step right. Again, the correct order of steps is: Taking 3 steps left = 10 steps right. Thus, the answer is yes.
